result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie R. NOVAK

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The State moves to dismiss and read in all counts. The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 99, 15 CF 256 and 14 CF 403.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
The parties have reached an agreement.  Attorney Pangburn requests a new plea date.
Plea date is reset to 07-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 07-14-15 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-3.
It is hereby ordered, for the reasons stated on the record on 03-27-15, the defendant's motion to suppress is denied.

MOTION TO SUPPRESS - 
The Court takes the position that this motion was already heard and denied in Branch 1.  He cannot reverse another Court's ruling and therefore, denies the motion.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-24-15 at 11:00 a.m.
State to draft the order.
Minutes.
Motion to Suppress Fruits of Vehicle Search.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection. 
Cover Letter

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-30-14 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 01-29-15 at 10:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

rescheduled from 8:30 a.m.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-24-14 at 8:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess heroin, possess dug paraphernalia and possess schedule II drug.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
